frameDefinitions: This frame concerns a Cognizer's certainty about the correctness of beliefs  or expectations.
An Agent causes a Dryee (either a surface or an entire entity, inside and out) to become dry.

A Cognizer possesses knowledge about the workings, significance, or meaning of an idea or object, which we call Phenomenon, and is able to make predictions about the behavior or  occurrence of the Phenomenon.
A Believer has faith in a piece of Content or an Element  which fits into a religious belief system made up of many articles of faith.
A Cognizer has a piece of Content in their model of the world.
This frame concerns the movement of a Theme and an Agent and/or Carrier.
frameExamples: Lermontov was <t>certain</t> he would come to the party.
I figured this out last week and now I really <t>understand</t> it.
Do Muslims <t>believe</t> in the virgin birth of Jesus?
Your boss is <t>aware</t> of your commitment.
Karl <t>carried</t> the books across campus to the library on his head.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person whose certainty or uncertainty is at issue.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the entity that a <fen>Cognizer</fen> has a certain/uncertain belief about.
The <fen>Content</fen> denotes the mental content that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is certain or uncertain about.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part that conveys the mental state of  the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person performing the intentional act causing the <fen>Dryee</fen> to become dry.
The <fen>Dryee</fen> is the entity which has the water removed from it.
An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces the state of dryness. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of <fen>Cause</fen>s.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> intentionally affects the <fen>Dryee</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> intentionally affects the <fen>Dryee</fen>.
The sentient animate being who acquires new knowledge.
A state of affairs or dynamic system whose internal make-up and working the Cognizer comes to assimilate into their knowledge structure.
A part  of a person's cognitive-emotional faculties that is said to acquire knowledge.
This role indicates the when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> asssimilates the new knowledge.
The <fen>Believer</fen> is the person whose religious beliefs are in question.
The <fen>Content</fen> is the object of the <fen>Believer</fen>'s religious conviction. <fen>Content</fen> can be expressed as a finite clause or in a in-PP Complement.
<fen>Role</fen> is a  function that an Element of the faith is believed to serve.
A predefined, fixed idea to which reference is made throughout the belief system.

The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person whose awareness of phenomena is at question. With a target verb or adjective the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is generally expressed as an External Argument with the <fen>Content</fen> expressed as an Object or Complement.
The <fen>Content</fen> is the object of the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s awareness. <fen>Content</fen> can be expressed as a direct object or in a PP Complement.
Some verbs in this frame allow a <fen>Topic</fen> to be expressed in about-PPs.
<fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part that reveals the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s state to the observer.
The time interval during which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is aware of the <fen>Content</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is a sentient being who physically controls the movement of the <fen>Theme</fen> via the carrier, accompanying the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<fen>Goal</fen> identifies the endpoint of the path.
<fen>Source</fen> indicates the beginning of the path along which the <fen>Theme</fen> travels.
Path along which carrying occurs.
The objects being carried.
<fen>Area</fen> is used for descriprion of a general area in which the carrying action takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular or not to consist of a single, linear path.
The <fen>Carrier</fen> provides support for the <fen>Theme</fen>.  Movement of the <fen>Carrier</fen> results in movement of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The time in which the carrying event takes place.
The <fen>Place</fen> is the general area that serves as a setting for the specific motion of the <fen>Agent</fen> and <fen>Theme</fen> (with <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen>, or <fen>Goal</fen>).
listRoleExamples: <fex>Marcel</fex> was sure that she had seen Eldridge on the balcony.
She talked of quests , of finding this absurd religious character , but he was unsure <fex>of her conviction</fex>.
I am sure <fex>that we'll arrive on time</fex>.
She caught sight of her mother's dubious <fex>expression</fex>.
<fex> Michael</fex> dehydrated the apples.
Michael dehydrated <fex>the apples</fex>.
<fex>The wind</fex> dried the porch.
<fex>Sue</fex> grasped the essentials right away
You must grasp <fex>the complex relationship of all these subjects to each other</fex>
<fex>My heart</fex> grasped that reality immediately.
<fex>Yesterday</fex> the students finally grasped the meaning of the equation
A Christian believes <fex>that Jesus of Nazareth was a prophet</fex>.
If a person believes in Jesus <fex>as his Saviour</fex>, he can he baptized.
I believe <fex>in Jesus</fex>
<fex>Your boss</fex> is aware of your commitment.
Your boss is aware <fex>of your commitment</fex>.
Kim knows <fex>about first aid</fex>.
Bob's <fex>eyes</fex> were overly aware

Yet there is no evidence that Mr. Parrish was cognizant <fex>at the time of the signing
of the notes</fex> that the clauses in issue were present.
<fex>Karl</fex> carried the books across the campus to the library.
Karl carried the books <fex>to the library</fex>.
Karl hauled the books <fex>from the library</fex>  to the office.
Karl carried the books <fex>across the campus</fex>.
Karl toted <fex>the books</fex> to the car.
<fex>The boat</fex> ferried the troops across the river.
<fex>Even in such a small port</fex>, these boats would transport many tons of trade-goods in to shore annually.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: April, May, June, July, August, September, October, November, December
